member.name: P:SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.UnicodeOptions
member.summary: Allows to specify options to properly convert Unicode, such as "Fonts" directory etc
member.remarks:
Advice for developers who creates ASP.Net or Silverlight projects:
Some hosting providers disables any access to windows directories. For example, GoDaddy doesn't allow to read directory "Windows\Fonts".
We recommend to create own "Fonts" directory in your project and copy *.ttf files to it from "Windows\Fonts". You may copy only several fonts, but we recommend to put the font "Arial Unicode MS" - ARIALUNI.TTF anyway.
See picture:

member.summary: Class which allows to set custom sheets from workbook for converting

member.summary: Set custom cells which will be exported into PDF or Word.

member.name: M:SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.CSheet.All
member.summary: Convert all sheets from workbook

example.code: Dim x As New SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf() x.Sheets.All() x.ConvertFile("d:\Workbook.xls", "d:\Hardcopy.pdf")

member.name: M:SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.CSheet.Odd
member.summary: Convert odd sheets from workbook

example.code: Dim x As New SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf() x.Sheets.Odd() x.ConvertFile("d:\Workbook.xls", "d:\Hardcopy.pdf")

member.name: M:SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.CSheet.Even
member.summary: Convert even sheets from workbook

example.code: Dim x As New SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf() x.Sheets.Even() x.ConvertFile("d:\Workbook.xls", "d:\Hardcopy.pdf")

member.name: M:SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.CSheet.Custom(System.Int32[])
member.summary: Convert custom sheets from workbook

code.title: Specify custom sheets of workbook for converting
Specify custom sheets of workbook for converting

example.code: Dim x As New SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf() x.Sheets.Custom(New Integer() { 1, 3 }) x.ConvertFile("d:\Workbook.xls", "d:\Hardcopy.pdf")

member.name: M:SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.CPageStyle.CPageScale.Percent(System.Int32)
member.summary: Allows to specify page scale in percentages: from 1...10000.
member.remarks: Please notice that page margins will not be scaled. So, to get the proportional scale, please set all page margins to 0.

member.name: M:SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.CPageStyle.CPageScale.Auto
member.summary: Convert without any scaling.

member.name: M:SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.CPageStyle.CPageScale.FitByWidth
member.summary: Fit each Excel sheet to a one PDF page depending of the page width. Thus, either to decrease the scale or leave as is if sheet could be fitted by page width. This is the default option.

member.name: M:SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.CPageStyle.CPageScale.ScaleByWidth
member.summary: Make the scale the same as PDF page width. Thus, either to decrease or to increase scale.

member.name: M:SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.CPageStyle.CPageScale.FitByHeight
member.summary: Fit each Excel sheet to a one PDF page depending of the page height. Thus, either to decrease the scale or leave as is if sheet could be fitted by page height.

member.name: M:SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.CPageStyle.CPageScale.ScaleByHeight
member.summary: Make the scale the same as PDF page height. Thus, either to decrease or to increase scale.

member.name: M:SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.CPageStyle.CPageScale.ScaleToOnePage
member.summary: Make the scale close as possible to page size to fit the sheet into a single page. Simultaneously takes care of page width and height.

member.name: M:SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.CPageStyle.CPageScale.ScaleByPageBreak
member.summary: Convert with page break in excel document.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.CPageStyle.PageNumFormat
member.summary: Allows to set custom page numbers in produced document. By default: Page numbers located at the bottom-right of page and font face is "Helvetica" and font size is "10".
member.remarks:
Using this property you may set custom page numbers as you wish.
These are special keywords to custom page numbers in property Text:
{page} - current page number
{numpages} - total pages
By default: Page numbers located at the bottom-right of page and font face is "Helvetica" and font size is "10".
These are samples of using this property:
x.PageStyle.PageNumFormat.Text="Page {page} of {numpages}";

member.name: T:SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.CUnicodeOptions
member.summary: Class with properties which allows to specify Unicode options, such as "Fonts" directory etc
member.remarks: Use properties from this class only through the property See picture:

example.code: Dim p As New SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf() p.UnicodeOptions.DetectFontsDirectory = SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.CUnicodeOptions.eUnicodeDetectFontsDirectory.Auto 'p.UnicodeOptions.FontsDirectory = @"c:\windows\fonts\"; p.UnicodeOptions.FontsDirectory = Path.Combine(Server.MapPath(""), "Fonts\")

member.name: T:SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.CUnicodeOptions.eUnicodeDetectFontsDirectory
member.summary: Allows to specify type of finding *.tff files. This is necessary to insert Unicode inside PDF.
member.remarks:
Advice for developers who creates ASP.Net or Silverlight projects:
Some hosting providers disables any access to windows directories. For example, GoDaddy doesn't allow to read directory "Windows\Fonts".
We recommend to create own "Fonts" directory in your project and copy *.ttf files to it from "Windows\Fonts". You may copy only several fonts, but we recommend to put the font "Arial Unicode MS" - ARIALUNI.TTF anyway.
See picture:

member.name: F:SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.CUnicodeOptions.eUnicodeDetectFontsDirectory.Auto
member.summary: First tries to find the "Windows\Fonts" directory and in case of failure uses the directory from property In case of success finding directory "Windows\Fonts" the component will not search *.tff in Custom directory specified in . Therefore some *.ttf files located in custom directory can be missed.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.CUnicodeOptions.eUnicodeDetectFontsDirectory.NotDetect
member.summary: Unicode is disabled. Doesn't make any tries of reading HDD to find *.ttf files.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.CUnicodeOptions.eUnicodeDetectFontsDirectory.Custom
member.summary: Doesn't try to find the "Windows\Fonts" directory and uses only the directory from property to find all .ttf files

member.name: P:SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.CUnicodeOptions.DetectFontsDirectory
member.summary: Allows to specify type of finding *.tff files. This is necessary to insert Unicode inside PDF. Default value:
member.remarks:
Default value: Possible values:
- First tries to find the "Windows\Fonts" directory and in case of failure uses the directory from property. In case of success finding directory "Windows\Fonts" the component will not search *.tff in Custom directory specified in . Therefore some *.ttf files located in custom directory can be missed.
- Unicode is disabled. Doesn't make any tries of reading HDD to find *.ttf files.
- Doesn't try to find the "Windows\Fonts" directory and uses only the directory from property to find all .ttf files.
Advice for developers who creates ASP.Net or Silverlight projects:
Some hosting providers disables any access to windows directories. For example, GoDaddy doesn't allow to read directory "Windows\Fonts".
We recommend to create own "Fonts" directory in your project and copy *.ttf files to it from "Windows\Fonts". You may copy only several fonts, but we recommend to put the font "Arial Unicode MS" - ARIALUNI.TTF anyway.

example.code: Dim p As New SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf() p.UnicodeOptions.DetectFontsDirectory = SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.CUnicodeOptions.eUnicodeDetectFontsDirectory.Custom 'p.UnicodeOptions.FontsDirectory = @"c:\windows\fonts\"; p.UnicodeOptions.FontsDirectory = Path.Combine(Server.MapPath(""), "Fonts\")

member.name: P:SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.CUnicodeOptions.FontsDirectory
member.summary: Full local path to fonts directory (any folder with *.ttf files). Default value: "c:\windows\fonts\"
member.remarks:
By default it's set to "c:\windows\fonts\"
Advice for developers who creates ASP.Net or Silverlight projects:
Some hosting providers disables any access to windows directories. For example, GoDaddy doesn't allow to read directory "Windows\Fonts".
We recommend to create own "Fonts" directory in your project and copy *.ttf files to it from "Windows\Fonts". You may copy only several fonts, but we recommend to put the font "Arial Unicode MS" - ARIALUNI.TTF anyway.

example.code: Dim p As New SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf() p.UnicodeOptions.DetectFontsDirectory = SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.CUnicodeOptions.eUnicodeDetectFontsDirectory.Custom 'p.UnicodeOptions.FontsDirectory = @"c:\windows\fonts\"; p.UnicodeOptions.FontsDirectory = Path.Combine(Server.MapPath(""), "Fonts\")

member.name: T:SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.PdfSecurity
member.summary: Contains details for encrypting and access permissions for a PDF document, such as Password, Permissions etc.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.PdfSecurity.EncryptionAlgorithm
member.summary: Specifies the encryption algorithm to use. The default value is .

member.name: P:SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.PdfSecurity.OwnerPassword
member.summary: Specifies the owner password for the encrypted PDF document.

remarks.para: The owner password allows the user to open an encrypted PDF document without any access restrictions specified in .
The owner password cannot be the same as the user password. If you don't specify an owner password, then the system will generate a random password when generating the PDF document.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.PdfSecurity.UserPassword
member.summary: Specifies the user password required for opening the encrypted PDF document.

remarks.para: The user password will be required to open an encrypted PDF document for viewing. The permissions specified in will be enforced by the reader software.
The user password can be null or empty string, in this case no password will be required from the user when opening the PDF document. The user password cannot be the same as the owner password.

member.name: P:SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.PdfSecurity.Permissions
member.summary: Specifies the operations that are allowed to a user on an encrypted PDF document. The default value is .

member.name: T:SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.eOutputFormat
member.summary: Enumerator with types of produced documents: PDF, DOCX, RTF

member.name: F:SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.eOutputFormat.Pdf
member.summary: Set PDF as output document, *.pdf

member.name: F:SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.eOutputFormat.Word
member.summary: Set Word (*.doc) as output document, *.doc

member.name: F:SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.eOutputFormat.Rtf
member.summary: Set RTF as output document, *.rtf

member.name: F:SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.eOutputFormat.Docx
member.summary: Set DOCX as output document, *.docx

member.name: T:SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.PdfPermissions
member.summary: Specifies the operations that are allowed to a user on an encrypted PDF document.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.PdfPermissions.DisallowAll
member.summary: Disallows all operations on the PDF document. This is the default value.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.PdfPermissions.AllowAll
member.summary: Allows all operations on the PDF document.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.PdfPermissions.ContentCopy
member.summary: Allows copying or otherwise extracting text and graphics from the document, including extraction for accessibility purposes.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.PdfPermissions.ContentCopyForAccessibility
member.summary: Allows extract text and graphics in support of accessibility to disabled users or for other purposes. When using RC4 40-bit encryption, this option is ignored and accessibility is allowed whenever ContentCopy is set.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.PdfPermissions.ModifyContents
member.summary: Allows modifying the documents contents.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.PdfPermissions.ModifyAnnotations
member.summary: Allows adding or modifying text annotations. When using RC4 40-bit encryption, this option also allows filling in form fields.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.PdfPermissions.FillIn
member.summary: Allows filling in forms and signing the document. When using RC4 40-bit encryption, this option is ignored and filling in form is allowed whenever ModifyAnnotations is set.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.PdfPermissions.DocumentAssembly
member.summary: Allows assembling the document: inserting, rotating, or deleting pages and creating navigation elements such as bookmarks or thumbnail images. When using RC4 40-bit encryption, this option is ignored and document assembly is allowed when ModifyContents is set.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.PdfPermissions.Printing
member.summary: Allows printing the document.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.PdfPermissions.HighResolutionPrinting
member.summary: Allows printing the document to the highest resolution possible. When using RC4 40-bit encryption, this option is ignored and high resolution printing is allowed when Printing is set.

member.name: T:SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.PdfEncryptionAlgorithm
member.summary: Specifies the encryption algorithm to use for encrypting a PDF document.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.PdfEncryptionAlgorithm.RC4_40
member.summary: RC4 encryption, key length of 40 bits.

member.name: F:SautinSoft.ExcelToPdf.PdfEncryptionAlgorithm.RC4_128
member.summary: RC4 encryption, key length of 128 bits.
